title: Bug 12428: Pull Up - Confusing message
description:
Bug 12428: Pull Up - Confusing message

The current message is not clear. It should be 'Copy method 'void setUp()' FROM type 'TestCase' (also with uppercase C in Copy).

Another issue is that if I select to delete setUp from TestCase, I get the message "Delete method 'void setUp()' declared in type 'junit.framework.TestCase'" under TestCase.

Markus suggests that the 'copy method' text should be consistent and also use the fully qualified name.
OB: The message for pulling up a method should correctly state 'Copy method 'void setUp()' FROM type 'TestCase' (with an uppercase C in Copy).
EB: The 'copy method' text should be consistent and also use the fully qualified name.
SR: Update the message for pulling up a method to correctly state 'Copy method 'void setUp()' FROM type 'TestCase' (with an uppercase C in Copy). Additionally, ensure the 'copy method' text is consistent and uses the fully qualified name.
